paper_abstract: In this paper, we are concerned with the stochastic differential delay equations with Markovian switching (SDDEwMSs). As stochastic differential equations with Markovian switching (SDEwMSs), most SDDEwMSs cannot be solved explicitly. Therefore, numerical solutions, such as EM method, stochastic Theta method, Split-Step Backward Euler method and Caratheodory's approximations, have become an important issue in the study of SDDEwMSs. The key contribution of this paper is to investigate the strong convergence between the true solutions and the numerical solutions to SDDEwMSs in the sense of the L(p)-norm when the drift and diffusion coefficients are Taylor approximations. Crown Copyright (c) 2009 Published by Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
paper_title: An analytic approximation of solutions of stochastic differential delay equations with Markovian switching
